all the time!
cool.. i'm trying to get Rsync on this machine to backup home directories on other ubuntu machines.. was thinking i might use ssh to create a drive mount?
yeah, rsync user@remote-machine:/some/path/ /some/local/path
You can just talk about remote machines like that and it will ssh for you and copy things to /some/local/path/
ok.. so i dont need to install anything?
the remote machine must be an ssh server (which is not installed by default)
the local machine needs rsync, (IDK if that's installed)
no
If you do a lot of rsync's from this server at once it will become slow (perhaps obviously
then it won't make the machine slow.  It will probably make the network all these machines are sharing slow
The load on the user machines in minimal using rysnc
.. and the ssh server?
You will not notice a difference while it is rsyncing on the client if there is only one rsync process going
the ssh server will become slow if there are many rsync processes going at once
that's right!
yeah, that's the nature of a server.  It is always running waiting for connections
no (I don't it)
this is probably the lightest weight way
Additionally, I doubt you will notice any slow-ness while you're rsyncing
we're splitting hairs.  Try it and see how little it affects the speed of the machine
